segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 35
segments.en: Linked Discourses 35

segments.pli: 12. Lokakāmaguṇavagga
segments.en: 12. The World and the Kinds of Sensual Stimulation

segments.pli: 115. Dutiyamārapāsasutta
segments.en: 115. Māra’s Snare (2nd)

segments.pli: “Santi, bhikkhave, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati—
segments.en: If a mendicant approves, welcomes, and keeps clinging to them,

segments.pli: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu baddho cakkhuviññeyyesu rūpesu, āvāsagato mārassa, mārassa vasaṃ gato, paṭimukkassa mārapāso.
segments.en: they’re called a mendicant who is bound when it comes to sights known by the eye. They’re trapped in Māra’s lair, fallen under Māra’s sway, and caught in Māra’s snare.

segments.pli: Baddho so mārabandhanena yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato … pe ….
segments.en: They’re bound by Māra’s bonds, and the Wicked One can do what he wants with them.

segments.pli: Santi, bhikkhave, jivhāviññeyyā rasā … pe …
segments.en: There are sounds … smells … tastes … touches …

segments.pli: santi, bhikkhave, manoviññeyyā dhammā, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: thoughts known by the mind that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati—
segments.en: If a mendicant approves, welcomes, and keeps clinging to them,

segments.pli: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu baddho manoviññeyyesu dhammesu, āvāsagato mārassa, mārassa vasaṃ gato, paṭimukkassa mārapāso.
segments.en: they’re called a mendicant who is bound when it comes to thoughts known by the mind. They’re trapped in Māra’s lair, fallen under Māra’s sway, and caught in Māra’s snare.

segments.pli: Baddho so mārabandhanena yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato … pe ….
segments.en: They’re bound by Māra’s bonds, and the Wicked One can do what he wants with them.

segments.pli: Santi ca kho, bhikkhave, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: There are sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati—
segments.en: If a mendicant doesn’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to them,

segments.pli: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu mutto cakkhuviññeyyehi rūpehi, nāvāsagato mārassa, na mārassa vasaṃ gato, ummukkassa mārapāso.
segments.en: they’re called a mendicant not trapped in Māra’s lair, not fallen under Māra’s sway, and released from Māra’s snare.

segments.pli: Mutto so mārabandhanena na yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato … pe ….
segments.en: They’re free from Māra’s bonds, and the Wicked One cannot do what he wants with them.

segments.pli: Santi, bhikkhave, jivhāviññeyyā rasā … pe …
segments.en: There are sounds … smells … tastes … touches …

segments.pli: santi, bhikkhave, manoviññeyyā dhammā, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: thoughts known by the mind that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati—
segments.en: If a mendicant doesn’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to them,

segments.pli: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu mutto manoviññeyyehi dhammehi, nāvāsagato mārassa, na mārassa vasaṃ gato, ummukkassa mārapāso.
segments.en: they’re called a mendicant not trapped in Māra’s lair, not fallen under Māra’s sway, and released from Māra’s snare.

segments.pli: Mutto so mārabandhanena na yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato”ti.
segments.en: They’re free from Māra’s bonds, and the Wicked One cannot do what he wants with them.”

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ.
